result.execSummary:
All charges against Steven Ray Hendricks Jr. in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven Ray Hendricks Jr. is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Ray Hendricks Jr.

records.addlTxt:
03:13 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: V.Melstrom, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Scott Selmer, DF: Steven Ray Hendricks appeared.   Includes 22CM4, 22TR52, 22TR53, and 22TR66. Court reviews case. ADA Rockow recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Recess 03:22 PM. Back on Record 03:31 PM. Atty Selmer states DE would like to move forward today with sentencing. Defendant understands and pleads No Contest to 22TR66 and 22TR53. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses 22TR52 and 22CM4. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:

22TR66
Count 1:

- F/F: $874.50
- 7 months License revocation w/o IID

22TR53
Count 1:

-F/F $114.50 

Apply any bond on file to F/F.


Adjourned at 03:34 PM

DE called @ 12:15 pm asking for the Zoom info for his May hearing. DE was advised that he just had a court hearing today in which he was advised that he must appear in person for his plea/sent hearing. DE stated he has transportation issues. DE was advised he'll need to submit a req to the judge ASAP & was given the info required on his req, his case #'s, & the fax #. Includes 22CM4, 22TR52, 22TR53, 22TR66. jaf
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Record reflects that DE confirmed / repeated on record date and time of next hearing. Adjourned:  11:23 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Status conference on January 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant to test clean before release.
 
Defendant to schedule RULE 25- as soon as possible. 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to drug testing and ETG testing today for baseline. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
